text.base: The rung snaps with a pistol-crack sound. Gravity takes you. You hit the ground hard, the breath driven from your lungs in a white-hot flash of pain.

lens.believer: The earth didn't catch you; it grabbed you. Pulled you down.
lens.skeptic: Right ankle. Likely Grade 2 sprain. Impact velocity was... survivable.
lens.haunted: This is what you deserve. Falling always felt more natural than climbing.
